data.title: Greatest videogame voice actors?
data.meta_description: I was just reading up some stuff on IMDB when I saw a very familiar name.It was Michael Bell, the guy who voiced Raziel, so I clicked on his...
data.text:
Jan 4, 2004 Add bookmark #1 I was just reading up some stuff on IMDB when I saw a very familiar name.

It was Michael Bell, the guy who voiced Raziel, so I clicked on his filmography.

This is an impressive resume.

This 65 year-old's voice has been in the ears of gamers for almost ten years now (if you count the Sonic the Hedgehog cartoon) and he's brought dialogue to life on a veritable A-List of videogames for the last 5 years or so.

His non-videogame voice-list ain't too shabby either (Spider-Man, Hulk, X-Men, Transformers, GI Joe), but I digress.

He's a star in his own right, and I find it intriguing. I wonder how it must be to work as a voice actor.

Please opine and emote. Jan 4, 2004 Add bookmark #2 Charles Martinet, who does everything Mario and a quite impressive number of other characters as well.

Jennifer Hale, who gave Fall-From-Grace voice.

Kristoffer Tabori, who did HK-47 in KotOR. "Combat mode . . . active!" Jan 4, 2004 Add bookmark #3 Let me copy and paste his game work. Hope it formats properly.


Legacy of Kain: Defiance (2003) (VG) (voice) .... Raziel
... aka Legacy of Kain: Soul Reaver III (2003) (VG) (USA)

Rei: Beni Chou (2003) (VG) (voice)
... aka Fatal Frame II: Crimson Butterfly (2003) (VG) (USA)

Ratchet and Clank: Going Commando (2003) (VG) (voice) .... Security System, Interview Announcer, Biker Two, Mutant Crab, Protopet Announcer

Metal Gear Solid 2: Substance (2002) (VG) (voice) .... Russian Soldier

Eternal Darkness: Sanity's Requiem (2002) (VG) (voice) .... Journalist Peter Jacob
... aka Eternal Darkness (2002) (VG) (USA: short title)

... aka Bloody Roar: Primal Fury (2002) (VG) (USA)

Emperor: Battle for Dune (2001) (VG)

Forgotten Realms: Baldur's Gate - Dark Alliance (2001) (VG) (voice) .... Karne...

Metal Gear Solid 2: Sons of Liberty (2001) (VG) (voice: English version) .... Russian Soldier #1
... aka MGS2 (2001) (VG) (abbreviated title)
... aka Metal Gear Solid 2 (2001) (VG) (USA: short title)

Legacy of Kain: Soul Reaver II (2001) (VG) .... Raziel
... aka Legacy of Kain Series: Soul Reaver 2, The (2001) (VG) (USA: complete title)

... aka Red Alert 2 Expansion Pack: Yuri's Revenge (2001) (VG) (USA)

... aka Command & Conquer: Red Alert 2 - Yuri's Revenge (2001) (VG) (USA)

Fallout Tactics: Brotherhood of Steel (2001) (VG) (voice)

Forgotten Realms: Baldur's Gate II - Shadows of Amn (2000) (VG) (voice)

Forgotten Realms: Icewind Dale (2000) (VG) (voice) .... Larrel/Additional Voices

Star Wars: Force Commander (2000) (VG) (voice) .... Gen. Taskeen/Tatooine farmer

Sword of the Berserk (2000) (VG) .... Guts

Star Trek: Starfleet Command: Volume II: Empires at War (2000) (VG)

Giants: Citizen Kabuto (2000) (VG) (voice) .... Various Voices

Sacrifice (2000/II) (VG) (voice)

Star Trek: Deep Space Nine - The Fallen (2000) (VG) (voice) .... Obanak/Wraith Obanak/Bajoran Man

Nox (2000) (VG) (voice)

Star Trek: New Worlds (1999) (VG)

Command & Conquer: Tiberian Sun (1999) (VG) (voice) .... Additional Voices (Firestorm Only)
... aka Command & Conquer: Tiberian Sun Firestorm (1999) (VG) (USA)

Legacy of Kain: Soul Reaver (1999) (VG) (voice) .... Raziel, Melchiah

Forgotten Realms: Baldur's Gate (1998) (VG) (voice) .... Galkin/Gatewarden/Nimbul

Blazing Dragons (1996) (VG) (voice) Jan 4, 2004 Add bookmark #4 I was trying to express my fascination, and I understand what's so amazing about this list to me.

Being involved in the production of such classic titles in a (videogame) career that spans almost a decade must be terrific. Just being around the developers and injecting real life into characters and narratives...that job must be fantastic.

What's also amazing is the range of the guy's work. I'd never have known that he voiced Gatts. He worked on Sacrifice AND Giants, two often-overlooked excellent and unique titles that shared a similar type of niche success.

Call of Duty!!

The Metal Gear Series!!

And of course, his trademark...Raziel.

Awesome. Jan 4, 2004 Add bookmark #5 More info on Bell, including a pic and the rest of the Kain cast here.

Tony Jay, the voice of the Elder God, also has a few good roles behind his name. Only about ten or so though. Jan 4, 2004 Add bookmark #6 Wow...Jennifer Hale's list kicks almost as much ass as Bell's, if not more. Not too familiar with her voice though, other than the Torment, Freelancer and Sacrifice ones. All sounded very similar, now that I think about it. Jan 4, 2004 Add bookmark #7 Kris Tabori's just begun apparently, but after HK I can see him being snatched up for lots more work.

(What's HK-47 good for other than amusing dialogue and translation, btw?) Jan 4, 2004 Add bookmark #8 Tony Jay's got an awesome distinctive voice. his Transcendent One in Torment is one of the best game voices I've ever heard (and a similar voice is done in Soul Reaver - the godlike voice helping out Raziel in the beginning) Jan 4, 2004 Add bookmark #10 Bruce Campbell - Lots of B grade films and Tachyon the Fringe, and Spider-Man The Game and a couple of others if I recall correctly.

[This message was edited by Timarok on January 04, 2004 at 10:19.] Jan 4, 2004 Add bookmark #11 ^^^^

Damn, beat me to it Timarok

edit: and not a bad space sim either
cetainly better than starlancer Jan 4, 2004 Add bookmark #12 Sarah Hamilton, who played April Ryan from The Longest Journey was excellent. Tim Curry as Gabriel Knight in Sins of the Fathers was also good. Jan 4, 2004 Add bookmark #14 I like Blizzard game's voice acting, but it does suffer from them using the same voices between games. When I first heard The Prophet in Warcraft 3, I thought 'hey, its Nihlathak", or "hey, The King of Lorderon is the barbarian who gives you the ral-ort-tal runes". Jan 4, 2004 Add bookmark #15 Blizzard uses a lot of Blizzard employees as voice actors. I think that's the main reason for hearing similar things in different games. Jan 4, 2004 Add bookmark #17
quote:
Originally posted by Huma_22:
Kris Tabori's just begun apparently, but after HK I can see him being snatched up for lots more work.

(What's HK-47 good for other than amusing dialogue and translation, btw?)

Heh, I just listed Tabori for HK. He did do an awesome job there.

(HK is pretty good if you give him a souped-up rifle and some of the fancy equipment from Yavin.)

I'd list some japanese voice actors here. Japanese people just seem to be better at this than the rest of the world. Too bad I can't tell their names apart with my primitive european brain. Jan 4, 2004 Add bookmark #18 Hm, almost all Japanese VAs do anime and stuff as well, I guess my personal favorite would be Inoue Kikuko. She has a fucking massive credit list, her game credits include I-No (Guilty Gear XX), Lobelia Carlini (Sakura Taisen 3) and Rose (Japanese MGS2). She usually plays the sultry and/or psychotic female characters, and she does it pretty damned well. One of my friends is a die-hard Tomizawa Michie fan, but she just retired last year. She is Sumire Kanzaki, one of the main characters in Sakura Taisen, I have no idea what the series will do without her. Jan 4, 2004 Add bookmark #20
quote:
Originally posted by Vault Dweller:
Jay Anthony Franke - J.C. Denton - Deus Ex


Sans the "A BOMB" line. -- View image here: http://episteme.arstechnica.com/infopop/emoticons/icon_smile.gif -- Jan 4, 2004 Add bookmark #21 Oh yeah, I also get a kick out of Hiyama Nobuyuki's work as Joe Higashi in King of Fighters, Ichimonji Batsu in Justice Gakuen, Nightmare/Sigfried in Soul Calibur, and Link in Smash Brothers Melee. Jan 4, 2004 Add bookmark #22
quote:
Originally posted by Crispy:
Oh yeah, I also get a kick out of http://www.win.ne.jp/~toshi/seiyuu/hiyama-nobuyuki/roles.html work as Joe Higashi in King of Fighters, Ichimonji Batsu in Justice Gakuen, Nightmare/Sigfried in Soul Calibur, and Link in Smash Brothers Melee.

Hah! I knew the guy who voiced Siegfried was the same who did Link in SSB and OoT the moment I heard him! I was just too lazy to check. -- View image here: http://episteme.arstechnica.com/infopop/emoticons/icon_biggrin.gif --

Small world, I guess. I rather like digging through the VA credits and finding out that characters from two obscure games you barely remember were done by the same VA. Jan 4, 2004 Add bookmark #23 I'm surprised no one's mentioned Mark Hamill yet...

Star Wars: Jedi Knight - Jedi Academy (2003) (VG) (voice) .... Luke Skywalker

X2 - Wolverine's Revenge (2003) (VG) (voice) .... Wolverine
... aka X-Men 2: Wolverine's Revenge (2003) (VG) (UK)

Scorpion King: Rise of the Akkadian, The (2002) (VG) (voice) .... Apep, Additional Voices
... aka Scorpion King, The (2002/II) (VG) (USA: short title)

Christopher 'Maverick' Blair Jan 4, 2004 Add bookmark #24 While in his youth Mark Hammill was generally regarded as decent screen actor, he is friggin' awesome as a voice actor. He played the Joker on Batman the animated series! -- View image here: http://episteme.arstechnica.com/infopop/emoticons/icon_eek.gif --

-Anti Jan 4, 2004 Add bookmark #26 You mean this thread has gone on this long and noone has mentioned Cam Clarke? For shame. Jan 4, 2004 Add bookmark #27 Lucy Liu in SSX Tricky...maybe just cuz she's Lucy Liu. -- View image here: http://episteme.arstechnica.com/infopop/emoticons/icon_smile.gif -- Jan 4, 2004 Add bookmark #29 the guy who voiced Max Payne was very good, he right amount of cliche grit etc. Also, although it isn't necessarily great voice acting, it's certainly memorable; all those quotes made by EACH character in Blizzard RTS games. I love the "Iron Chef" spoof from Warcraft3.

And all the old c&c games (pre-Generals) had great voice acting and great movies, too. Jan 4, 2004 Add bookmark #30 Yeah the guy who did the voice over for Max Payne 2 sounded convincing for the part although at times he tended to sound monotonous.

i wonder who did the voice of Bastilla in Kotor.. grrr.. dig that sexy brit accent. Jan 4, 2004 Add bookmark #31 Rob Paulsen -- Aside from the quoted video games, he was Pinky on the Animaniacs. He was Peej from Goof Troop, Gusto on the Gummi Bears, in Transformers, GI Joe .. tons and tons of show.

Jan 4, 2004 Add bookmark #32 omg...Paulsen was Morte!!

I was thinking about Hamill, but his animated work outshines his VG work to such a large degree, I thought the thread would digress.

Also, special mention goes out to Lazlow. Jan 4, 2004 Add bookmark #33 you people should all be ashamed of yourselves
my opinion, hands down, has to be the guy who did Manny Calavera's voice in grim fandango.

you all owe it to yourselves to play this if you haven't already. Jan 4, 2004 Add bookmark #34
quote:
Originally posted by savutti:
i wonder who did the voice of Bastilla in Kotor.. grrr.. dig that sexy brit accent.


Mentioned already earlier in this thread:

Jennifer Hale - http://us.imdb.com/name/nm0354937/

This site has a picture (it won't let me link it): http://www.tvtome.com/tvtome/servlet/PersonDetail/personid-19292

She also did the voice of "Fall From Grace" from Planescape as well as the main character from Eternal Darkness. And she actually does sorta look like Bastila. -- View image here: http://episteme.arstechnica.com/infopop/emoticons/icon_eek.gif -- Jan 4, 2004 Add bookmark #35 my bad.. thanks for pointing it out Wang

ahh so she did the voice over.. nice

::imagines Bastilla in a dominatrix outfit:: that would be a sight -- View image here: http://episteme.arstechnica.com/6/ws/images/plotting.gif -- Jan 5, 2004 Add bookmark #36 I don't know if this counts since the voice was so heavily altered but how about Terri Brosius as Shodan. Jan 5, 2004 Add bookmark #37 I would have to give my votes for David Warner as Irenicus in Baldur's Gate 2. Probably, my favorite was Bill Johnson as the Guardian in Ultima 7. When his laughing would appear sometimes when you were travelling over land. It game me the willies.

=w= Jan 5, 2004 Add bookmark #38 Garrett from Thief and the narrator of Baldurs gate were great.

The greatest voice over in the history of gaming voiceovers was the one that planet tribes did themselves for the original "All your base are belong to us" inspiration....:

http://www.planettribes.com/allyourbase/video3.shtml
